title: Pesticide Storage | From the Ground Up

subtasks: Limiting human and animal access to chemicals
Considering safety measures for youths and animals
Adhering to chemical labels for safety information
Storing chemicals by category (e.g., insecticides vs herbicides)
Not storing chemicals in food containers
Proper storage of personal protective equipment (e.g., gloves, glasses)

tasks.task: Putting it all together, the MAINTASK is managing chemicals, with subtasks on access control, label adherence, proper storage, and protecting PPE. That seems comprehensive. Let me check if I'm missing anything. Oh, the speaker mentions to look at the fact sheet for more info. Maybe that could be a task, but since it's more of an external resource, perhaps not necessary for the tasks directly derived from the transcript. The other part about the Jacksonville Foundation and Austin is completely off-topic, so I should disregard that.
